decision_conditions: The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), polices D1, and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings:

Application form; Block Plan; Existing Ground Floor Plan; Existing First, Second & Loft Plans; Existing Front (North) & Rear (South) Elevations; Existing Side (East & West) Elevations; Proposed Ground Floor Plan; Proposed First Floor & Roof Plans; Proposed Front (North) & Rear (South) Elevations; Proposed Side (East & West) Elevations; OS Map;

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | No part of the roof of the ground floor rear extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
description: Single storey side extension, with associated internal alterations (following partial demolition of existing side wall); external alterations to the front facade of dwelling house, involving insertion of a window in lieu of the existing garage door opening.
